name: Tryp Cayo Coco

reviews.text: I spent 2 weeks in late May, and early June at the Tryp CC. This resort is not a 5 star nor is it priced like one. It was perfectly fine for what I paid to go there. While not as glitzy as some resorts I've stayed at in Mexico, it was very nice and about half the price. The landscaping was awesome, and while the rooms were a little tired, they were clean and the beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: I'll go back
Excellent Family Vacation
reviews.text: Food in the buffet was fine, not exceptional, but fine. I had the grilled chicken or beef most nights and never went hungry or had a bad meal. The rum balls in the desert displays were to die for.mmmmm I tended to sit in the same area of the buffet for most meals and the waiter took very good care of me. I tipped him only just before my stay was over but still got good service.

I'm not a big drinker, but I had many nice drinks. I'd take my travel mug to a bar when it wasn't terribly busy and ask for something sweet with rum. I had some great drinks, very few of which seemed to have names. I rarely tipped, but always had good service.
reviews.title: just cant recommend this place-wish i could

reviews.text: Dance lessons, were always enjoyable and I miss my 5pm salsa and marange lessons!
reviews.title: best holiday ever!!!!
Just ok
reviews.text: The Entertainment-I was very impressed by the quality of the live bands, and the dancers at this resort. The shows were excellent and the entire entertainment staff are to be commended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Tryp Cayo Coco from July 16th 2006 to July 23rd 2006 and had the VIP upgrade. We really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to anybody, particularly families with young children. In this review we have written about things that were good, things that we bad, and tips and so on. If you are just a couple wanting a nice romantic getaway, we would suggest finding another resort in the area that is for adults only. This one is really good if you have children though. We are writing this review in hopes that it may benefit at least a few people. If we have a knowledge of certain things, why not share that knowledge with others... right.
reviews.title: Thorough review and suggestions
Honest Review
reviews.text: Bars:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - If you tip the bartenders generously, they will come to you first everytime you step up to the bar area for the rest of the night even when it is busy. They will also give you the bigger-size glass cups as opposed to the plastic cups they usually give out. You can even sit there and watch them continue giving out the plastic cups to others.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.text: - If you offer the bartender 3 CUC for any bottle at the bar, they will tell you to go to the cigar/liquor store to get a bag to put the bottles in. The bartender will then look around to see if there are any Managers or Supervisors around and then ask you to pass the bag around the counter, then put the bottles in and pass the bag back to you. Keep in mind that the bartender could get fired for this. I gave 10 CUC for 3 bottles and am currently making the same Blue Coco drinks at home now. Try to Blue Coco drink. Don't forget to stir it up.
reviews.title: Nice Holiday

reviews.text: TV:
reviews.title: Quite good!
Great Place/Bad Food
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the tryp, and I would have to say it was o.k overall but the food was a problem. You dont go to Cuba for the food, you go for the beach ( which was amazing)but they have food handling issues.The food is not cooled or heated as it should be, there is cross contamination,ex. they plate the food with utensils that were in raw fish and chicken. My girlfriend and I were both sick two days into the trip but it passed after that day. We took extra care after that and we were fine.
BESIDES THAT
reviews.title: great deal & good times

likes.liked: — the fabulous a la carte restaurant
likes.disliked: — slightly cheesy entertainment (never lacked enthusiasm though!)

reviews.text: - Beach was topnotch
reviews.title: great time had by all

likes.disliked: — Only 1 bottle of water given in an all inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Best Mojito
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.text: - Great staff
reviews.title: Abismal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the TRYP from July 8-15 and I must say the resort did not dissapoint me. After reading some of the bad reviews I need to defend the TRYP. I am not sure why people feel the need to complain about every little thing, you are on holidays, relax. The food was good, nice pool, beach was amazing, the rooms were clean and there was plenty of alcohol, what more do you want in a holiday!! Here are the great things I found there.
reviews.title: Good Times at the TRYP

reviews.text: The resort itselfis quite nice, looks absolutely beautiful at night when the pool is all lit up. The workers there are up very early making sure that the grounds are clean before the crowd comes.
reviews.title: Never again!!!!

likes.disliked: — rooms and overall filth of resort

reviews.title: Hated it!
reviews.text: The main pool was great, not too busy and we always could find a beach chair, but get up a little earlier in the morning and save one if you want shade. Bring some rubber tubes to play around in the water with, keeps you busy for hours The pool bar was great too. I found the service to be great, but if you tip 1-2 pesos at the beginning of the day the service was even better. I never felt like tipping was expected and I only tipped after good service. Also, bring a large coffee mug, the bartenders will gladly fill that up for you so you don't have to get the little glasses.

reviews.title: Ain't no 4 star hotel
reviews.text: Food: I found the food to be great, I ate like a pig the whole time I was there. For breakfast go to the omlet station or the pancake station, there may be a bit of a wait, but it is well worth it. I always found the evening buffet to be excellent as well. Go for the meat frying station, the stir fry station (my favorite), or the pasta station, they will not dissapoint you. I had only minor stomach problems while I was there. Like travelling anywhere internationally, bring Immodium.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For lunch we almost always ate at the pizza bar. The pizza is great, this is a must if you go to the TRYP. While at the pizza bar ask for a Barcaza special. I don't know what they put in that drink but it is sure good.
reviews.title: I will go back

description: The 4-star All-Inclusive Tryp Cayo Coco hotel (508 rooms) offers select gastronomic service and an exciting day and night recreation program. The property is located in one of the pristine keys off the coast of the central region of Cuba.Built over a natural lagoon, facing and wide stretch of sugar-white beach. Ideal for families, diving lovers, fishing and nautical activities.Guest Rooms508 rooms: 343 Standard, 57 Standard Ocean View, 102 Standard Superior Ocean View, 6 SuiteDining9 Restaurants (A la Carta, Buffet, Barbeque, Gourmet), 3 Bars
